name: CarrotPress
author: Mark Root-Wiley (MRWweb)

sections.description:
Adds a healthy does of Vitamin A to the WordPress Admin, putting carrots into all your checkboxes and radio buttons.

Other Plugins by MRWweb

  • MRW Simplified Editor – Tame the WordPress Classic and Block Editors to help WordPress users focus on creating consistent, accessible, and portable content.
  • Post Type Archive Descriptions – Add user-editable descriptions to the top of post type archive pages.
  • Post Status Menu Items – Adds post status links–e.g. “Draft” (7)–to post type admin menus.
  • Feature a Page Widget – Feature a single page in any sidebar.
sections.faq:
Is it a good idea to use this plugin on a site with a lot of users?

Probably not.

Is it a good idea to use this plugin on a site with a lot of buns?

Definitely.

When can I use this plugin?

International Carrot Day (April 4), National Eat Your Vegetables Day (June 17, USA only), World Vegetarian Day (October 1), and World Vegan Day (November 1).

What do you get when you cross a carrot with the block editor?

Rootenberg.
sections.changelog:
2.0.0 (10 Feb 2021)

  • The Gutenbunny is here! Carrots for all the editors (and the Media Library too)!

1.0.0 (19 Sept 2014)

  • Welease the wabbits!

short_description: A carrot a day keeps the developer away.
